table.caption: Cult of the Dragon Renown
rows: The Cult of the Dragon provides you a {@book Poor lifestyle|XPHB|6|Lifestyle Expenses} for free at its hideouts.
You can hire Cult of the Dragon hirelings for half the usual cost.
You receive the honorary rank of dragonclaw. The first time your Renown Score reaches 10, the cult rewards you with one random Uncommon magic item.

You receive the honorary rank of dragonwing. You can assign a squad of up to six {@creature Cultist|XMM|Cultists} to perform any task that doesn't directly conflict with the cult's doctrine. Once you use this reward, you can't do so again until your Renown Score increases.

You receive the honorary rank of dragonfang. You can request the aid of one {@creature Cultist Fanatic|XMM} for a mission. Once you use this reward, you can't do so again until your Renown Score increases.
The first time your Renown Score reaches 30, the cult rewards you with one random Rare magic item.

You receive the honorary rank of dragonsoul. You can call in a favor to make a specific Humanoid creature "disappear" for {@dice 1d10} days. You must know the name of the target creature, but you don't need to know their location. Once you use this reward, you can't do so again until your Renown Score increases.

You receive the honorary rank of Wearer of Purple. All cultists obey your instruction and openly provide you information. In addition, you can request an audience with the cult's inner circle. Once you use this reward, you can't do so again.
